trans-unit.source: A mailing-list, pyfai@esrf.fr, is available to get help on the program and how to use it. One needs to subscribe by sending an email to sympa@esrf.fr with a subject “subscribe pyfai”.
trans-unit.target: A mailing-list, pyfai@esrf.fr, is available to get help on the program and how to use it. One needs to subscribe by sending an email to sympa@esrf.fr with a subject “subscribe pyfai”.

trans-unit.source: If you are using MS Windows you can also download a binary version packaged as executable installation files (Chose the one corresponding to your python version).
trans-unit.target: Si utiliza MS Windows también puede descargar una versión binaria empaquetada como archivos de instalación ejecutables (Elija la correspondiente a su versión pitón).

trans-unit.source: If you prefer a local installation (only you will have access to the installed version):
trans-unit.target: Si prefieres una instalación local (sólo tú tendrás acceso a la versión instalada):

trans-unit.source: If you want pyFAI to make use of your graphic card, please install pyopencl
trans-unit.target: If you want pyFAI to make use of your graphic card, please install pyopencl

trans-unit.source: Implementation in parallel is described in the proceedings of EPDIC13: PyFAI: a Python library for high performance azimuthal integration on GPU. doi:10.1017/S0885715613000924
trans-unit.target: La implementación en paralelo se describe en las actas de EPDIC13:PyFAI:una librería de Python para la integración azimutal de alto rendimiento en la GPU.doi:10.1017/S0885715613000924

trans-unit.source: Provide the –user to perform an installation local to your user. Under UNIX, you may have to run the command via sudo to gain root access an perform a system wide installation.
trans-unit.target: Provide the –user to perform an installation local to your user. Under UNIX, you may have to run the command via sudo to gain root access an perform a system wide installation.

trans-unit.source: Python 2.7, 3.5, 3.6 and 3.7 are well tested. Python 2.6, 3.2 and 3.3 are no more supported since pyFAI 0.12 Python 3.4 has beed dropped with 0.19 For full functionality of pyFAI the following modules need to be installed.
trans-unit.target: La pitón 2.7,3.5,3.6 y 3.7 están bien probadas.Python 2.6,3.2 y 3.3 ya no están soportados desde que pyFAI 0.12 Python 3.4 ha sido eliminado con 0.19 Para la completa funcionalidad de pyFAI los siguientes módulos deben ser instalados.

trans-unit.source: Python implementation of fast azimuthal integration
trans-unit.target: Implementación en Python de una rápida integración azimutal

trans-unit.source: To use pyFAI on Ubuntu/Debian the needed python modules can be installed either through the Synaptic Package Manager (found in System -> Administration) or using apt-get on from the command line in a terminal:
trans-unit.target: To use pyFAI on Ubuntu/Debian the needed python modules can be installed either through the Synaptic Package Manager (found in System -> Administration) or using apt-get on from the command line in a terminal:
Distribuciones de Linux similares a Ubuntu y Debian

trans-unit.source: Under 32 bits windows, pyFAI can be built using The MinGW compiler. Unfortunately, pyFAI will be limited to small images as the memory consumption, limited to 2GB under windows, is easily reached. With 64 bits windows, the Visual Studio C++ compiler is the only one known to work correctly.
trans-unit.target: Bajo ventanas de 32 bits,pyFAI puede ser construido usando el compilador MinGW.Desafortunadamente,pyFAI se limitará a pequeñas imágenes ya que el consumo de memoria,limitado a 2GB bajo windows,es fácilmente alcanzable.Con ventanas de 64 bits,el compilador de Visual Studio C++es el único que se conoce que funciona correctamente.

trans-unit.source: You are advised to build pyFAI with the GCC compiler, as the compiler provided by Apple with XCode (a derivative of clang) lakes the support of OpenMP. If you use Xcode5 or newer, append the “–no-openmp” option to deactivate multithreading in binary modules. You will also need cython to re-generate the C-files and delete src/histogram.c before running:
trans-unit.target: You are advised to build pyFAI with the GCC compiler, as the compiler provided by Apple with XCode (a derivative of clang) lakes the support of OpenMP. If you use Xcode5 or newer, append the “–no-openmp” option to deactivate multithreading in binary modules. You will also need cython to re-generate the C-files and delete src/histogram.c before running:

trans-unit.source: pyFAI is also available via conda:
trans-unit.target: pyFAI también está disponible a través de conda:

trans-unit.source: pyFAI is an azimuthal integration library that tries to be fast (as fast as C and even more using OpenCL and GPU). It is based on histogramming of the 2theta/Q positions of each (center of) pixel weighted by the intensity of each pixel, but parallel version uses a SparseMatrix-DenseVector multiplication. Neighboring output bins get also a contribution of pixels next to the border thanks to pixel splitting. Finally pyFAI provides also tools to calibrate the experimental setup using Debye-Scherrer rings of a reference compound.
trans-unit.target: pyFAI es una librería de integración azimutal que intenta ser rápida (tan rápida como C y aún más usando OpenCL y GPU).Se basa en la histogramación de las posiciones 2theta/Q de cada (centro de)píxel ponderadas por la intensidad de cada píxel,pero la versión paralela utiliza una multiplicación SparseMatrix-DenseVector.Los contenedores de salida vecinos también obtienen una contribución de píxeles junto al borde gracias a la división de píxeles.Finalmente pyFAI también proporciona herramientas para calibrar el montaje experimental usando anillos Debye-Scherrer de un compuesto de referencia.
